snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin said he hoped invasion of what he called “new Russia” would not be necessary. He also said for the first time that Russian forces had been sent to Crimea.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin appears on national television and brashly declares Russia's historical claims over Ukrainian territory and reiterates threat to use military force, sounding a defiant, even mocking, tone toward the United States; Putin also calmly acknowledges for first time that Russian troops had been deployed to occupy and annex Crimea.
lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin said he hoped invasion of what he called “new Russia” would not be necessary. He also said for the first time that Russian forces had been sent to Crimea.

headline.main: Away From Show of Diplomacy in Geneva, Putin Puts On a Show of His Own
headline.print_headline: Away From Show of Diplomacy in Geneva, Putin Puts On a Show of His Own
